newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends lower on hedge pressure.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends lower on hedge pressure.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures ended lower on substantial hedge pressure and on overall weakness in grains and oilseeds, traders said.
Traders said Wednesday's hedge pressure was significant because it had been absent for the most part, this season as wheat producers held out for higher prices.
A late break in CBOT grains and soybeans helped undermine values in MGE spring wheat, traders said.
MGE spring wheat closed 2-3/4 to 10 cents per bushel lower, with Sept down 2-3/4 cents at $4.55-3/4. Dec lost eight cents to close at $4.37 per bushel.
Traders said Atwood Peavey bought 1.3 million Dec bushels and sold one million Sept. LFG bought 1.5 million Dec and sold one million Dec, they said.
The Minneapolis Grain Exchange estimated Wednesday's spring wheat volume at 33.39 million bushels, above 30.131 million bushels Tuesday.
MGE barley closed unchanged to six cents per hundredweight (cwt) higher, with Sept unchanged at $7.40. Dec gained six cents to close at $7.43 per cwt.
